title: "Clown Apocalypse" - Vancouver Fringe Festival
description:
When the world ends, only the clowns will survive. This hilarious and heartbreaking physical comedy follows three clowns as they navigate the wasteland of a post-apocalyptic society. Using minimal dialogue, masterful slapstick, and unexpected poignancy, 'Clown Apocalypse' finds humor in hopelessness and beauty in the absurd. Winner of Best Physical Comedy at the Toronto Fringe Festival.

PERFORMANCE DETAILS:
Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025
Time: 7:30 PM
Venue: Performance Works
Duration: 60 minutes
Creator: Fool Hardy Productions
Origin: Toronto, ON

Part of the 2025 Vancouver Fringe Festival. The Fringe showcases unconventional, independent theatrical productions with shows selected through a lottery system rather than a juried process, ensuring a diverse range of performances.

venue.name: Performance Works on Granville Island
venue.description: Performance Works is a versatile black box theatre space on Granville Island that hosts a variety of innovative Fringe performances.

title: "The Millennials vs. The Apocalypse" - Vancouver Fringe Festival
description:
In this satirical comedy, a group of millennial friends faces the end of the world with nothing but their smartphones, overpriced coffee, and crippling student debt. As climate disaster, economic collapse, and a zombie outbreak converge, they must overcome their generational stereotypes to save humanityâ€”or at least get enough likes on their apocalypse selfies. A biting commentary on generational divides, social media addiction, and the very real anxieties of growing up in uncertain times.

PERFORMANCE DETAILS:
Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025
Time: 8:00 PM
Venue: Red Gate Revue Stage
Duration: 65 minutes
Creator: Avocado Toast Theatre Company
Origin: Vancouver, BC

Part of the 2025 Vancouver Fringe Festival. The Fringe showcases unconventional, independent theatrical productions with shows selected through a lottery system rather than a juried process, ensuring a diverse range of performances.

venue.name: Red Gate Revue Stage
venue.description: The Red Gate Revue Stage is an intimate venue on Granville Island that features experimental and cutting-edge Fringe performances.

title: "Grandmother's Attic" - Vancouver Fringe Festival
description:
In this touching one-woman show, playwright and performer Eleanor Chen unpacks her grandmother's belongings after her passing, discovering untold stories of immigration, resilience, and sacrifice. Through storytelling, puppetry, and object manipulation, Chen brings to life three generations of Chinese-Canadian women and their complex relationships to identity, belonging, and the objects they carry through life. A delicate exploration of family history and the stories contained in everyday items.

PERFORMANCE DETAILS:
Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025
Time: 8:00 PM
Venue: Firehall Arts Centre
Duration: 60 minutes
Creator: Eleanor Chen
Origin: Vancouver, BC

Part of the 2025 Vancouver Fringe Festival. The Fringe showcases unconventional, independent theatrical productions with shows selected through a lottery system rather than a juried process, ensuring a diverse range of performances.

venue.name: Firehall Arts Centre
venue.description: The Firehall Arts Centre is housed in a heritage fire station in Vancouver's Downtown Eastside and features a 136-seat theatre that hosts Fringe Festival productions.

title: "Whispers in the Dark" - Vancouver Fringe Festival
description:
An immersive horror experience that blends puppetry, shadow play, and binaural sound design to create a uniquely terrifying theatrical event. Audience members are given headphones and led through a tale of ancient family secrets and supernatural revenge. As the boundaries between performance and reality dissolve, each audience member becomes part of the unfolding nightmare. Not recommended for those with claustrophobia or sensitivity to darkness.

PERFORMANCE DETAILS:
Date: Thursday, September 4, 2025
Time: 5:30 PM
Venue: Firehall Arts Centre
Duration: 75 minutes
Creator: Shadow Box Theatre
Origin: Seattle, WA

Part of the 2025 Vancouver Fringe Festival. The Fringe showcases unconventional, independent theatrical productions with shows selected through a lottery system rather than a juried process, ensuring a diverse range of performances.

venue.name: Firehall Arts Centre
venue.description: The Firehall Arts Centre is housed in a heritage fire station in Vancouver's Downtown Eastside and features a 136-seat theatre that hosts Fringe Festival productions.

title: "Shakespeare's Lost Play" - Vancouver Fringe Festival
description:
Three Shakespearean scholars claim to have discovered a lost play by the Bard and perform it for the first time in 400 years. As their academic rivalry intensifies and the authenticity of their discovery comes into question, the performance devolves into a hilarious blend of genuine Elizabethan verse, wild improvisation, and scholarly meltdowns. This love letter to Shakespeare manages to be both academically sharp and wickedly funny.

PERFORMANCE DETAILS:
Date: Thursday, September 4, 2025
Time: 9:30 PM
Venue: Performance Works
Duration: 90 minutes
Creator: Bardolators Anonymous

Part of the 2025 Vancouver Fringe Festival. The Fringe showcases unconventional, independent theatrical productions with shows selected through a lottery system rather than a juried process, ensuring a diverse range of performances.

venue.name: Performance Works on Granville Island
venue.description: Performance Works is a versatile black box theatre space on Granville Island that hosts a variety of innovative Fringe performances.

title: "The Quantum Paradox" - Vancouver Fringe Festival
description:
A mind-bending theatrical experience that explores the nature of reality through parallel universes. When physicist Dr. Maya Chen creates a machine that can glimpse alternate realities, she discovers versions of herself that made vastly different life choices. As the boundaries between worlds begin to blur, she must confront the roads not taken and decide which reality is truly hers. This innovative one-woman show features stunning visual projections, original music, and a tour-de-force performance that questions the very fabric of existence.

PERFORMANCE DETAILS:

Time: 9:00 PM
Venue: Waterfront Theatre
Duration: 70 minutes
Creator: Lumina Theatre Collective
Origin: Vancouver, BC

Part of the 2025 Vancouver Fringe Festival. The Fringe showcases unconventional, independent theatrical productions with shows selected through a lottery system rather than a juried process, ensuring a diverse range of performances.

venue.name: Waterfront Theatre at Granville Island
venue.description: The Waterfront Theatre is a 224-seat venue on Granville Island that hosts some of the largest productions at the Vancouver Fringe Festival.

title: "Queer FolklÃ³rico" - Vancouver Fringe Festival
description:
A dazzling solo performance that combines traditional Mexican dance with contemporary queer storytelling. Performer and choreographer Marco Espinoza reimagines the folkloric dances of his childhood through the lens of his identity as a gay man, creating a vibrant tapestry of movement that honors tradition while boldly stepping into new territory. Featuring stunning costumes, stirring music, and personal narrative, this show celebrates the intersection of cultural heritage and LGBTQ+ identity.

PERFORMANCE DETAILS:
Date: Friday, September 5, 2025
Time: 7:00 PM
Venue: Revue Stage
Duration: 55 minutes
Creator: Marco Espinoza
Origin: Mexico City, Mexico

Part of the 2025 Vancouver Fringe Festival. The Fringe showcases unconventional, independent theatrical productions with shows selected through a lottery system rather than a juried process, ensuring a diverse range of performances.

venue.name: Revue Stage at Granville Island
venue.description: The Revue Stage is located on Granville Island and is one of the festival's main venues, offering an intimate performance space for Fringe productions.

title: "The Art of Falling" - Vancouver Fringe Festival
description:
A breathtaking circus-theatre piece that explores themes of trust, vulnerability, and resilience through aerial arts. Five performers weave together stunning acrobatics, personal narratives, and visual poetry as they literally and metaphorically explore what it means to fall and rise again. With original live music and innovative rigging, 'The Art of Falling' transforms the Waterfront Theatre into a vertical playground where gravity becomes both adversary and ally.
